global_timing_1.text: This is the global time. It represents the time spent in the current game.

global_timing_2.text: You can pause and resume the game at any time. With the arrows, you can increase the speed of global time scrolling by up to 3x.

hexagon_1.text: The hexagons represent each component of the project with which you can interact.

hexagon_2.text: Hexagons, with no border, are NOT interacting.

hexagon_3.text: If a hexagon has a white border you can click on it. There is a maximum time to click the hexagon before the border disappears. The click time changes each time.

hexagon_4.text: When a hexagon is clicked the border turns yellow and the question to be answered is shown on the right terminal.

progressbar_1.text: This the progress bar! The stages deadline should be missed before the countdown reaches zero.

progressbar_2.text: Now you can see the progress bar’s  increasing, the green deadline is missed(well done!) and the grey one is reached :(

progressbar_3.text: The zones will appear according to your answers, they have effects on the progress bar speed!

progressbar_4.text: You lose when the progress bar reaches the final deadline, and you win when you miss the final deadline.

anonymitybar_1.text:
This is the anonymity bar, it represents your anonymous state inside the team.
		
		Remember: Don’t get busted!

anonymitybar_2.text: It fills out during the game  according to your answers that might have impact on it.

anonymitybar_3.text:
Once the anonymity bar is filled completely, you have sabotage button activated.
		It can be used to sabotage the process, that is reducing the final deadline time.

terminal_1.text: This section represents the interactible terminal.

terminal_2.text: You will always be able to scroll through the history in the terminal so that you can devise a strategy based on your previous responses.

terminal_3.text: When a hexagon is clicked the question is shown on the terminal. CAUTION: THE ANSWER TO CHOOSE IS THE MOST WRONG ANSWER OF THOSE PROPOSED.
